reviews.review: Beautiful place well laid out. Sadly there has been some vandalism to parts of the park. Though there are signs that this may be repaired in the near future.
Lovely open park by the shore of Lough Neagh, great view of Coney Island. Nice children's play area and places to walk, plenty of car park space.
The park is kept beautiful and clean, its a nice walk, there is a kids play area and exercise machines located on the trail.
Beautiful place but the toilet facilities are disgusting. Overflowing bin. Dirty toilets. And no waste bins anywhere. I'm sure it could be managed better.
A stunning stunning place even in the cold of January, a beautiful walk and a very interesting history. For anyone that ever visits the Macroom area this is a must.
It's very simply a stunning location. The wildlife is beautiful and comes reasonably close. The walk is simple if you like it or a bit tougher if you desire.
Great amenities for all family. Public toilets and ice cream coffee shop at the park at entry to beach. Lots of a tree area for walks and cycles.
The scenery is nice,but there's only one picnic table and the entrance needs instructions.
Nice little hiking trails and wonderful views. Only problem is the lack of directions and if you don't pay attention you could easily get lost.
Lovely walk through woodland and structured gardens. Dog friendly!  Bicycles available to hire; going to try that next time. Good coffee and homemade carrot cake in the teashop afterwards.
Beautiful woods, well taken care off. There is a main pathway you can walk or cycle. There's also a few other off the beaten tracks into the forest area that proves to be beautiful and lush.
Long hiking trails, bicycle ways, magnificent landscapes, nature, vegetation, diversity of living things... simply  awesome but one day is not enough.
Beautiful peaceful stop. Could spend days here.
Great walking trails. The highest point in westmeath is also located here.
Great loop walk couple of different routes depending fitness, the pathway leeds all the way to Benbulben, Few seating spots along the way to bask in the views of Sligo.
Beautiful place for walks. Unfortunately there have been constructions/renovations at the time of the visit so many trails markings were not adequate. Worth visit anyway.
Lovely gardens, and castle buildings. Large carpark, toilet facilities, water for dogs.
